"Teachers must understand what lessons to impart, or they cannot prepare students to be transferred to the higher grade. . . . In the place of bringing into our schools books containing the suppositions of the world's great authors, they will say, Tempt me not to disregard the greatest Author and the greatest Teacher, through whom I have everlasting life. He never mistakes. He is the great Fountainhead whence all wisdom flows. Then let every teacher sow the seed of truth in the minds 
                                                                           39
of students. Christ is the standard Teacher."-- Test., Vol. VI, p. 160.
